epp:phrases.epp:phrase: You haven't specified a document type!
You need to select a file to be shown first.

epp:phrase.p: The amount of disk space available for new EPrints has dropped below the repository threshold. New disk space will be needed soon.
If you get sick of this message, lower the "diskspace_warn_threshold" in the config file. If you do this then don't forget to put it back after you add more disk space.
The usual way to add disk space is to symlink a directory on a new drive into the repository "documents" directory.
There are no available partitions with enough disk space to create new items. This needs sorting out urgently.
NO NEW ITEMS WILL BE ADDED UNTIL YOU FIX THIS.
To add more capacity, symlink a directory on a new drive into the repository "documents" directory.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: A year search must be specified as a single year, e.g. `2000', or a range of years, e.g. `1990-2000', `1990-' or `-2000'
A numerical search must be specified as a single integer number, e.g. `23', or a range of numbers, e.g. `9-21', `17-' or `-93'
A date search must be specified as a single date or a range.
Search field contains no indexable words: "". The system ignores very small or common words.
Enter some text to search for.
Select one or more values from the list. Default is (Any).
Enter a term or terms to search for.

Enter a name or names to search for. Either the family name, or the family name followed by a comma and the first name or initial. Names with spaces may be indicated by surrounding them with double quotes, eg. "van Damme, J".
Select one or more values from the list, and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Select one or more values from the list, and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Select one or more values from the list, and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Enter one or more usernames (space separated) and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Enter a term or terms to search for.
Enter a term or terms to search for.
Enter some text to search for.
Enter a single year (e.g. 1999), or a range of years, e.g. `1990-2000', `1990-' or -2000'.
Enter a single number (e.g. 93), or a range of numbers, e.g. `17-23', `17-' or -23'.
Select a single record ID number (e.g. 93), or a range of numbers, e.g. `17-23', `17-' or -23'.

Occasionally, uploading this way may not produce a totally accurate copy. This is because some assumptions about the structure of the HTML must be made, to stop the software from trying to upload the whole World-Wide Web!

Please enter the filename (with full path) of the document file in the box below.

When you are satisfied click the Deposit Item Now button at the foot of this page.
Thank you.
Your submission will now be held for review. Provided there are no problems it should appear in the repository within the next few days.

You are viewing a version of this configuration file which has been edited via the web interface, but not successfully installed. To revert to the last (probably OK) version, use the Revert button below.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: The specified ID code is not a valid ID code.
Please enter the ID code of the item you wish to view below. You can enter a standard ID code, an Open Archives full ID code, or just the digits on the right hand side of an ID code.

epp:phrase.p: Registration is not enabled on this system.
In order to access some areas of the repository, you'll need a user registration. No charge is made for registering with us or using any of our services.
This page lets you register with . This will allow you to save searches, receive alerts and deposit items.
Your new password will need to confirm your email address by using a code which will be mailed to you.
If you have already registered but have forgotten your username or password, click here to set a new password.
You have not filled in the "" field.
A user with the email address already exists.
Rather than register, you should just reset your password.
Another user already has the username already exists.
You have registered with username .
This registration will not be activated until you visit the confirmation URL which has been emailed to

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: This will set which language is used for automated emails
This must be a valid email address.
A username must begin with a letter and only contain letters and numerals.
A combination of uppercase and lowercase letters and numerals.

epp:phrase.p: To register, use the Registration Form.
If you have registered but have forgotten the password you may set a new password using the Reset Password Form.
This feature is not available on this system.
If you are an existing user but have forgotten your password then you may use this form to set a new one.

This code is only valid for .
Nothing new in the last 7 days.
User not found. It is possible that indicates a database problem, but please check the parameters in the URL carefully.
The confirmation pin is incorrect. Please try and reset your password to generate an email with a new confirmation pin number.
The confirmation pin number has timed out. Please repeat the reset password or registration request, and confirm it as soon as you get the email.
There are currently no changes for this user which await confirmation. This probably means you have already confirmed the change. Try and login.

The system is currently unable to send email. Please try again later. If this problem persists, please contact the administrator with details.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Please select the most appropriate type for your deposit.
If this item is a revised version of another document in the repository, please enter its ID code in this box.
If your item is a commentary on another item (or author's response to a commentary) in the repository, please enter its ID in this box.
The Latitude of this item. Southern latitudes should be expressed as a negative.
The Longitude of this item. Western longitudes should be expressed as a negative.
Leaving this field blank will not affect the password.
Set a password. This will not be activated until you enter a security code which will be mailed to you.
The subjects within which this user may "edit" eprints. That is they may review and approve/bounce them etc.
The email address for this user
Your preferred language. Where possible information will be mailed in this language.
The user will only be able to approve and modify items which match the following rules. If there are no restriction conditions the user will be able to edit any item.
How often do you want to be sent a list of all the items in review matching your editorial scope.
If there are no items under review, within your scope, should the repository still send you an empty email?

epp:phrase.label: Yes, mail me when there is nothing under review.
No. Only mail me when there is something under review and within my scope.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: The Latitude associated with this user. Southern latitudes should be expressed as a negative.
The Longitude associated with this user. Western longitudes should be expressed as a negative.
Please indicate the primary language of this format.
Please select the storage format of this document.
You may offer an additional brief description of the format.

Please indicate the required "security level" of this document. Who is allowed to download it? If you set this to anything other than "anyone" then consider adding a contact email for this eprint (on the next page), this will allow users to use a web form to request a copy of the document, and you can decide on a case-by-case basis.
Specify an explicit license for this document (does not effect the access rights you grant at the end of this deposit process). This repository allows Creative Commons licenses.

The date that a publisher- or sponsor-imposed embargo expires. On and after this date, this document will be made publicly accessible.
Example: 2006 - all documents made publicly accessible on 1st January 2006
Example: 2006 June - all documents made publicly accessible on 1st June 2006
The file which is linked to.
This is the "screen" name of the subject, the one that the users will see.
Subjects which this subject is part of (including itself).
Can users add items to this subject?

epp:phrase.label: Yes, users can add items to this subject.
No. (In which case it should probably have some children.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: This is the internal key for this subject. It is used in the database and to generate the "views" filenames. It should contain only a-z, 0-9 and dash "/"and underscore "_". If you enter the ID of an existing subject then that subject will be linked as a child of the current subject.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Problem changing status of item with the ID "".
Return to user work area, allowing the user to make changes to it and re-deposit it.
Removes the item from the archive.
Item has been queued for re-indexing (may take some time to complete).
Use this to submit a new version of this item. It will create an exact copy which you can then make changes to. This item and the new version will be linked.
New versions successfully created in your work area. You are now viewing the new version.
Create a new item using this item as a template. There will be no connection between the two items.
New item successfully created in your work area using the previous item as a template. You are now viewing the new item.

epp:phrase.p: User (Email: ) requests the removal of the following item:
You should view the item details before determining whether to retire it from the live repository.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Request that this item is removed from the repository.

p.em: Please note that we strongly discourage removal of items from the repository. If you upload a new version of an items, a link to the later version will appear on the older version. Thus, anyone finding the old version will be able to see that a newer version has been deposited.

epp:phrase.p: You may view your saved searches and request to receive a periodic email update if anything in the search changes.
To create a new saved search, carry out a search and select Save search from the search results page.
You currently have no saved searches.
Are you sure you want to delete this saved search?

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Something went wrong with creating your saved search. Sorry.
That search has expired or was not created by you!
This saved search is not available to the public.

epp:phrase.p: Subject ID:

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: New child is an ancestor of this subject (This would cause a loop)
No ID given for new child

epp:phrase.p: Enter the ID of an existing child which is NOT an ancestor of the subject, or enter an unused subject id to create a new subject.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: The specified subject does not exist, or a database error has occurred.
Unlinked subject. This subject node still exists in other places in the subject tree.
Removed subject. This subject node has been deleted.
Created new subject node with ID "". Please now enter a subject name and set the subject to be depositable, if applicable.
Linked the existing subject node "" as a child of this subject node.
Search for items in this repository.
Search for users of this repository.
Search for actions that have occurred on items in this repository.

epp:phrase.p: To upload a document to this repository, click the Browse button below to select the file and the Upload button to upload it to the archive. You may then add additional files to the document (such as images for HTML files) or upload more files to create additional documents.
You may wish to use the SHERPA RoMEO tool to verify publisher policies before depositing.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: To convert this document to another format select the format you wish to convert it to and click 'Convert'. The conversion will create a new document - your old document will not be lost.
Specified document does not belong to current item.
Delete entire document: are you sure?

epp:phrase.epc:pin: Need to add additional files to this document?

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Wait! Are you really sure you want to add another file to this document? Only do this if the file is directly required by the document. For example an image required by an HTML document. If you are sure you want to then click OK. Most of the time you want to click Cancel then use the New Document field above.
Wait! You have selected a file to upload but not actually uploaded it. Do you wish to continue without uploading the file?

epp:phrase.p: No matches

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: This is a placeholder for the component
<> is an unknown virtual field inside <>

File imports are currently disabled, failed to import: . To enable file imports set "enable_file_imports" to 1 in SystemSettings (this is a security risk and should be disabled when your import is done).

Attempt to import eprint with document data expressed as a local filename. This is a security hole in normal use, and is disabled. It *is* useful when bulk importing and may be enabled by setting enable_file_imports.
Could not locate file for import: .
Could not write file ''. Error message:
Creative Commons Attribution Non-commercial No Derivatives
Creative Commons Attribution Non-commercial Share Alike

epp:phrase.a: Creative Commons Attribution Non-commercial No Derivatives
Creative Commons Attribution Non-commercial Share Alike

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: This name will be used to refer to this saved search
New or changed items matching this search will be mailed to you.
How often do you want to be sent this alert? A setting of "never" disables this alert.
If there are no new items matching your saved search, since it was last mailed, do you still want to be mailed?

epp:phrase.label: Yes, mail me empty alerts.
No. Only mail me alerts with content.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Do you want to be able to link directly to this search via a public URL?

epp:phrase.label: Yes, make this search available to anyone.
No. Only I will have access to this search.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: You may enter a rationale for requesting this document.
You must specify an email address.

epp:phrase.p: This item has been requested from by . Please can you respond.
The following reason was given:
Please consider removing restrictions or uploading the full text to the archive so that it will be available immediately to future searchers.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Your request has been sent. Return to item

epp:phrase.p: Your request for the following item has been passed on for action:

If you do not receive a reply or need advice at a later time please contact the administrator. For items with copyright implications, you may also be able to contact your local inter-library loan service.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Test your email configuration by sending a test email.
This is a test email sent by the administrator. If you received this your EPrints email configuration is working correctly!
Email successfully sent to . It may take a few minutes for the email to arrive, depending on your local conditions.

epp:phrase.p: You have chosen to accept the request for the following item:
An acceptance notice will be emailed to the requester with the requested document attached.
You have chosen to reject the request for the following item:
You may enter a reason below if you wish. This will be emailed to the requester along with a rejection notice.
This item has been made publicly accessible since the request was made:
A notice will be emailed to the requester.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Tick here to make this document publicly available from now on.

epp:phrase.p: Your request for the following item has been accepted:
Please find the requested document attached.
Your request for the following item has been rejected:
It may not always be straightforward to provide full text. Your local library may also be able to help you. For more general queries you may also contact the administrator.
The following reason was given:
The item you requested is now publicly accessible:

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Thank you. Your response has been sent.
Values used to sort the dataset for
Used to store highest identifier for eprints and users etc.
Contains fields waiting to be indexed by the indexer
This table is created by EPrints if it doesn't already exist in Oracle
Used to store metadata field records
Used to store info on eprints users
Used to store the heirarchical subject tree(s)
Used to store documents metadata, for ALL of archive,inbox,etc.
Used to store what seaches users have and the frequency of alert emails
Index to the tables used for temporarily storing search results
Used to store messages waiting to be shown to the user
Stores requests generated from the Web interface
Stores information about revisions made to objects (eprints, users etc.)
Stores requests made for full-texts to be delivered by email
